creator: rossb@apache.org
text:
I think it would be a good idea if the <style> task would allow filtering of the
files it reads or writes.  I'm for filter-on-read.
*** Bug 3966 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: umagesh@rediffmail.com

text:
The question of when to filter is a little more complex:

If filtering input, do we filter the style sheet or the xml input file(s)? both?

Could we filter the output easily? - I haven't looked at the code but I suspect 
coping with xmlns:redirect="org.apache.xalan.xslt.extensions.Redirect" would be 
difficult.

It seems to me that this would end up with a huge pile of options that would be 
much cleaner to implement as a series of existing tasks:

<copy ...>
  <filterset .../>
</copy>
<style .../>
<copy ...>
  <filterset .../>
</copy>

IMHO we have too many tasks with overloaded semantics at present and while it 
may be difficult to reduce this, we can work to stop it increasing.

Rob
creator: roxspring@yahoo.com

filterreaders are available in 1.5 and give more flexibility.
As mentioned by Rob, adding that to <style> would creep it with features.
